metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12390 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect origin serialization of URLs with IPv6 addresses could lead to incorrect security checks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 76.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
